question_title: Will SMCI's market close price on 2026-02-14 be higher than its market close price on 2026-02-02?
summary: SMCI's Q2 FY2026 earnings release on Feb 3 (after market close) is the dominant catalyst for this 8-trading-day comparison. The stock has missed earnings in 5 of 8 recent quarters (62.5%), suggesting elevated risk of disappointment. However, the stock is already beaten down ~45% in 3 months, trading near 52-week lows at a technical support zone ($28-30), meaning negative surprises may be partially priced in. Options markets imply ~12% move either direction. The conflicting signals - poor recent track record vs oversold conditions - suggest near-50% probability, with slight tilt toward NO based on the miss history.

factors.description: Earnings miss history - SMCI has missed estimates in 5 of 8 recent quarters (62.5% miss rate), suggesting above-average probability of disappointing on Feb 3
Stock near 52-week low and at strong support zone ($28-30) - beaten down 45% in 3 months suggests bad news may already be priced in
Raised FY2026 revenue guidance to $36B (from $33B) with $13B backlog signals strong demand visibility
Goldman Sachs Sell rating with $26 price target indicates some analysts see further downside despite current low levels
Options imply Â±12% move - high uncertainty binary event that could go either direction
Technical buy signals (MACD, pivot bottom) suggest short-term momentum may be turning positive
